item.description:
The Chris Coogan Quintet
7 PM

The Chris Coogan Quartet plays an exciting mix of jazz and originals.

Chris Coogan is a jazz and gospel musician who has been called “a masterful pianist” by The New York Times. Coogan’s credits include serving as music director for the jazz guitarist Sal Salvador. He has played with a range of entertainers, including Dave Liebman, Randy Brecker, Chris Parker, Steven Van Zandt, Paul Shaffer, Phoebe Snow, Jose Feliciano, Bette Midler, Donna Summer, Mavis Staples, Jane Powell, Kelli O’Hara and James Naughton. Coogan has performed at Manhattan’s Blue Note and Birdland and at the Montreaux Jazz Festival, as well as locally at parties for Martha Stewart and Paul Newman and Joanne Woodward. He has written and performed original Gospel music for a PBS prime-time documentary with Emmy award winning composer Brian Keane. He has performed Gospel with or for Jesse Jackson, Al Sharpton, Maya Angelou, Take 6, Richard Smallwood. In recent weeks, Chris has written 4 national spots for the Humane Society and has performed on many other jingles. Locally, you can find him teaching piano students, directing the Good News Gospel Choir, and performing at many area venues, including his monthly “Jazz at the Grange” series in Weston.

Playing for us this afternoon will be Chris Coogan on vocals and piano, JIm Royle on Drums, John Mobilio on Base and Rex Denton on Trumpet

The band will paly a broad range of jazz and standards from Louis Armstrong to Louis Jordan, Coltrane to Coogan Originals. Coogan is known for his wide repertoire and fanciful interpretations of well known material. Come and be ready to clap, sing and be entertained.

This program is part of our Dream Big Summer Reading program and is made possible thanks to the Friends of the Library. No registration.
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the entry to the performance space, will wear the black and white scare with piano keys
item.name: The Chris Coogan Quintet
